name: Chautauqua Cottages

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending the wedding of our nephew in Boulder, who suggested we stay at Chautauqua. We booked three nights in efficiency cottage #603 and loved the experience. The cottage was comfortable and charming, with a full kitchen, dining table, small seating area, queen bed, claw-foot tub, screened porch and WiFi. My only criticism is it could benefit from more reading lamps. Chautauqua consists of about a hundred old cottages on tree-lined streets; some are owner-occupied but the association rents the others like hotel lodging and its historic dining hall serves meals. I enjoyed feeling like we were part of a community and loved the location next to Boulder Mountain park trails. I hiked up a trail, was caught in a passing shower and then saw a double rainbow, which added to the magic of the surroundings.
reviews.title: Unique and enjoyable

likes.liked: — Staying in an historic community, surrounded by nature.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to escape to. No boring, dingy/impersonal hotel rooms here. The cottage was clean and bright and I felt right at home. The surrounding park was spectacular. You are staying a stones throw away from some really breath taking hiking trails and vistas. A wonderful place.
reviews.title: great escape

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, good location,right there in the wilderness!

reviews.text: We recently stayed here for several days when visiting Boulder with friends. The location was very nice. Our cabin was nice but our friends' cabin was in need of some repairs and updates. What was surprising was that the front office staff was rather cold. They always gave the impression that they were annoyed that customers were bothering them. The manager, Bert, was extremely rude. We were directed to speak to him about a problem. Mr. F was extremely impatient and rude and made it clear that he was unhappy to have to waste his time on us.
reviews.title: Rude manager

reviews.text: We stayed at Chautauqua Colorado cottages for a girls getaway weekend. We stayed in cottage #6. It was everything we could have wanted it to be. It had been updated with new appliances, comfy bedding and the heat worked beautifully. I say this because the cottage retains the appearance of something built in the early 1900s, yet was very comfortable. The view out the back screened in porch was beautiful. We saw a family of deer the morning we left. The cottage was only a 5 minute drive into Boulder, we could have walked it comfortably if it had been warmer. There are great trails on the property too. It was a wonderful trip and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this property to anyone looking for a relaxing break from a hectic pace. (There are no televisions or phones, but there is wireless internet available.)
reviews.title: Charming Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed at the Chautauqua in July and it was delightful. Simple and spotlessly clean, the cottage we had easily slept five of us in two bedrooms and a pullout for $165 a night! The kitchen made it possible to fix dinner each night (we strongly recommend buying meals ready to cook from The Organic Dish) and have bagels for breakfast. If you'd rather eat at the near by Dining Room, the food there was great value and fabulous. We walked into Boulder, went to concerts on the grounds and hiked on all the adjacent trails. No t.v. but we prefer that. Wireless is available a few hours a day or can be purchased for the whole day.
reviews.title: Best kept secret in Boulder

description: Founded in 1898 this National Historic Landmark is nestled beneath Boulder’s Flatiron Mountains. We are 40 miles from DIA and 1.5 miles from the Pearl Street Mall in downtown Boulder. With year-round lodging in our 58 charming cottages and two lodges, we offer an exceptional setting for reunions, weddings, retreats or a romantic getaway. Enjoy dining at the historic Chautauqua Dining Hall, concerts, educational programs, silent films and the critically acclaimed Colorado Music Festival.
